abstracts.cdata!:
The project was rated unsatisfactory.
            The following are some of the key lessons learned: 1) Time
            demands mandated a simpler project design. 2) The
            Bank's resettlement policy can sometimes create
            entitlements which imply difficult trade-offs. 3) Realistic
            assessment of the true costs of the irrigation/production
            package is essential. 4) Issues of subsidies for energy
            supply should be discussed and agreed during preparation and
            included in resettlement agreements signed by the affected
            parties. 5) In an inflationary environment and where large
            investments are involved, special attention to financial
            estimation is required to reduce risks. 6) Resettlement
            projects may be inappropriate candidates for economic
            justification in their own right. 7) There were clear
            differences between the challenges posed by urban
            resettlement and rural resettlement. 8) The Bank should
            pursue the full support of state and local authorities for
            the public utilities, social services, and other elements of
            resettlement propjets. 9) Disbursement percentages on major
            project components should be considered strategically,
            factoring in project objectives and timing. 10)
            Participation of resettlers in decision-making if conducted
            in a pressured, politically charged environment can force
            poor decisions.
